com.fizzikgames.fizlib.pathfinding

Class Path

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.fizzikgames.fizlib.pathfinding.Path

  • public class Path
extends java.lang.Object
    A path is a simple stack of nodes that allows nodes to be added and retrieved in the most useful manner.
    Version:
    1.00
    Author:
    Maxim Tiourin

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Path()
      Initializes the path by creating a new stack of nodes.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addNode(Node node)
      Adds a new node to the path by pushing it on to the stack.
      void clear()
      Clears the path of all nodes
      Node getNextNode()
      Retrieves the next node in the path by popping it off of the stack.
      int getSize()
      Returns the size of the path
      boolean isEmpty()
      Returns if the path is empty
      Node peekDestNode()
      Peeks at the node at the bottom of the stack, which is the destination node of the path.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
